Module kivakit.data.compression
Package com.telenav.kivakit.data.compression

Interface SymbolProducer<Symbol>

public interface SymbolProducer<Symbol>
A source of input symbols for a Codec to compress. Symbols can be retrieved by the codec through the get(int) method. When the codec cannot encode a symbol, it will call onEscape(ByteList, Object) to allow the implementer of this interface to write the symbol to codec output.

  • Method Details

    • fromList

      static <Symbol> SymbolProducer<Symbol> fromList​(List<Symbol> symbols)

    • singleton

      static <Symbol> SymbolProducer<Symbol> singleton​(Symbol symbol)

    • get

      Symbol get​(int ordinal)
      Returns:
      The next symbol in the sequence or null if the sequence has ended. The ordinal value is useful because the implementation of this interface may be an anonymous inner class.

    • onEscape

      default void onEscape​(ByteList output, Symbol symbol)
      Called by the codec when it cannot encode an input symbol. The codec will have already written an escape symbol and moved to the next byte in the output. The implementer of this method simply needs to write the symbol to the output in a format where it can be read back with a corresponding SymbolConsumer implementation.
      Parameters:
      output - The output to write the escaped symbol to
      symbol - The symbol to write

    • reset

      default void reset()
      If supported, resets the symbol sequence to the beginning so the symbols can be read again

    • size

      default int size()
      Returns:
      The number of symbols that will be encoded, or -1 if this value is unknown
